Omnishop for World Music, Foreign Language Films and Globals

The decline in airfares over the last 20 years due to stiff airline competition has spawned world travel to both exotic and famous must-see destinations. The introduction of the Internet to our daily lives not only has kept friends and family connected but also has allowed everyone to expand horizons and be curious about other cultures from all over the globe. The Earth has truly become one small world. This confluence of factors has led to the ever-growing trend for cross-cultural appreciation by the mass at large. And it will not go away.

This constant exposure and easier access to world heritage, history, globe trotting, regional cuisines as well as art from different periods, movements and countries, not to mention movies set in multiple exotic locations worldwide, provide continuous arousal in our curiosity and passion for cultural diversity. Hence, the birth of ZeMis, the online store that seeks to relive the memories from your exotic trip and to fill up your lifestyle with a colorful assortment of music, language and stories from across the globe.

July 22, 2010 – ZeMis, the ‘Global Omnishop’ @ www.zemis.com is pleased to offer a well-selected line up of world music audio CD’s , foreign language films on Blu-ray and DVD’s as well as books of fiction with a cross culture theme or a global backdrop . “In this day of working and interacting with colleagues, friends and neighbors from various ethnic backgrounds, taking the time to get to know more about their culture goes a long away in deepening valuable relationships. What better way to express cultural appreciation than through music, film and novels!”, exclaims, the creative visionary behind the online store.



The world music audio CD collection of ZeMis includes all the best selling Putumayo CD’s including Latin Lounge, Music from the Coffee Lands, Arabian Groove, Café Cubano, French Café, Afro-Latin Party, Acoustic Brazil, Blues Around the World, Women of the World, Turkish Groove, World Reggae and many more. ZeMis also offers Anthology of World Music series in audio CD including that from Iran, China, Lebanon and Morocco as well as the popular collection of The World’s a Stage featuring world music from Italy, Brazil and the Mediterranean. The audio CD department of ZeMis also features exotic tunes World Playground, Lullabies from Around the World, World Music for Little Ears.

The online music store has a comprehensive offering of world famous regional music as well as little known tunes from tiny countries. The music CD boutique showcases a wide array of Mediterranean, Calypso, Caribbean, Andean, Tribal, Buddhist, Gypsy, Mayan, Celtic music. ZeMis has also sourced hard to find, little known folk tunes and instruments like Tuku, Sitar from India, Maori of New Zealand, Gnawa music of Marrakesh and beats from Burkina Faso.

ZeMis’ internet video shop features award winning and critically acclaimed foreign language films from Europe, Africa, Latin America and Asia. Recent award nominated movies with a global setting like Invictus, The Young Victoria, An Education, The Hurt Locker and The Last Station are among the current best sellers in DVD/Blu-Ray. Hard to find world cinema titles such as Infernal Affairs, Lie To Me, Raise the Red Lantern, Run Lola Run, Scent of a Green Papaya, Babette’s Feast, Kolya, Il Postino or Osama and Waking Ned Devine are also available at significant discounts.

ZeMis’ online bookstore showcases novels with a global backdrop or cross-culture theme. National bestsellers, literary classics and obscure titles alike are available at the lowest prices possible. In addition to fiction, the internet bookshop also offers biographies, documentary style accounts on environmental issues, world religion reference books, recipe books on various regional cuisines and various topics on cultural appreciation.

Apart from media products with a global culture bent, ZeMis specializes in artisan craft through its product offerings of handmade designer neckpieces made from a mix of natural components, semi-precious stones as well as luxurious and hand woven exotic fabrics and glass beads, all artfully crafted together by skilled artisans. They represent a new breed of eco-luxurious accessories for nature loving yet sensible online shoppers.

ZeMis utilizes Amazon's e-commerce technology in order to provide ZeMis guests a safe, secure, and convenient online shopping experience . Transaction processing for ZeMis is handled by Amazon so buyers can use their Amazon.com account to order and checkout.

Stick to Nature With Organic Baby Care Layette

Almost every mother can attest to witnessing the perfection of nature as soon as human life spurts out from her womb. A newborn can find her way to her mom’s breast for food even with just a few seconds of life. That being the case, it would be a waste to introduce ‘foreign matter’ to a creature molded so perfectly. Say no to bleach and alcohol and welcome nature’s best with organic cotton towels and blankets to swaddle your infant! Baby care has never been more safe and warm.

July 29, 2010 – ZeMis, the online store otherwise known as Mother Nature’s boutique, is pleased to feature a wonderful array of organic baby layette and baby bath care items made from all natural ingredients. The green gift store offers natural bath products harnessed from different parts of the globe with reputable brands like Baby Bear Organic, Earth’s Best , Kiddopotamus, American Baby , Bumkins , Earth Mama Angel Baby , Naturepedic , Tadpoles , Nature’s Purest , Argington , Summer Infant and even baby-safe bath and skincare items from well known names like Korres , L’Occitane and Lush .



In addition to natural bed, bath and skincare products, ZeMis sells gift sets, baby gear and organic toys from Melissa and Doug , Nojo , Bumbo , Boon , Green Toys , Manhattan Toy . Managing Director for ZeMis, enthusiastically explains, “ZeMis is here to offer natural alternatives to baby care and comfort. We want our infants to be truly safe not just from accidents but more importantly from harsh chemicals that we caregivers, actually introduce to them.”

Apart from green baby items, ZeMis specializes in artisan craft through its product offerings of handmade designer neckpieces made from a mix of natural components, semi-precious stones as well as luxurious and hand woven exotic fabrics and glass beads, all artfully crafted together by skilled artisans. They represent a new breed of eco-luxurious accessories for nature loving yet sensible online shoppers.

Fall-Winter 2010-2011 Designer Accessories

Following a critically acclaimed Spring-Summer collection, ZeMis ‘trailblazes’ once again with one of a kind dramatic neckpieces that will fire up any cold winter evening. Featuring the traditional elements of nature - Earth and water plus wood and metal from the Chinese’ Wu Xing, ZeMis’ meticulously executed designer necklaces will surely add colorful texture to an otherwise neutral Fall/Winter 2010-2011 accessories season.

August 5, 2010 /ZEMIS LTD – ZeMis, the lifestyle accessories boutique known for natural products and accessibly-priced handmade statement neckpieces, is previewing its Fall-Winter 2010-2011 capsule collection on www.zemis.com entitled ‘Elements of Nature’. The full designer accessories set will showcase neckpieces, pendants, bibs, cuffs and brooches made from natural stones and eco-friendly components depicting images of Earth, water, wood and metal.



ZeMis specializes in exquisite neckpieces made from pearls, semi-precious stones, luxurious and hand woven exotic fabrics as well as crystals and glass beads, all artfully interlaced by skilled artisans. ZeMis’ designer and founder enthuses, “We’re very excited to launch this season’s collection to the public. Last season’s Wonders of the World theme rides well with the company’s aim of promoting world culture and world travel. This season’s theme of Elements encourages appreciation for Mother Nature, which is ZeMis’ other primary goal.” ZeMis’ handed out its global culture-themed and eco-friendly Spring-Summer accessories to celebrities with fabulous commendation. Lindy further exclaims, “Not only are our new neckpieces more creatively vibrant, but have also been priced more reasonably to cater to our growing patron base of ‘aspirational customers’.”

ZeMis debuted its designer accessories line in celebrity gifting events and handed out its AKT Vianca minaudiere to nominees, presenters and famous celebrities such as Jennifer Aniston, Reese Witherspoon, Paula Abdul, Eva Mendes and Sarah Jessica Parker as well as last year’s Oscar® winners and nominees, Penelope Cruz, Kate Winslet, Meryl Streep and Amy Adams and respected female actors like Cate Blanchett and Scarlett Johansson. This year, opulent neckpieces were handed out to Sandra Bullock, Drew Barrymore, Anna Kendrick, Mo’nique, Juliana Margolies, January Jones, Lea Michele, Penelope Cruz, Meryl Streep, Vera Farmiga Joan Collins and Maggie Gylenhaal.

ZeMis differentiates its products from other online stores selling jewelry and fashion accessories by presenting detailed product pictures with various angles and sketch diagrams showing relevant dimensions to give customers comprehensive information as well as delight, convenience and a seamless transaction experience.

For its Fall/Winter 2010-2011 collection, ZeMis generated a curious anthology of ‘neckpiece artworks’ inspired by the theme ‘Elements of Nature’. ZeMis used the Chinese Wu Xing Elements Earth, Water, Wood and Metal to spark a dazzling array of elegant but natural, practical yet artful necklaces and pendants. A preview of the Fall/Winter 2010-2011 line may be viewed at www.zemis.com .

A mix of classic best sellers and new hot items are up for grabs at basement prices for a limited period beginning September 14 to 23, 2010.

September 2, 2010 – ZeMis, the online retail store selling eco-friendly accessories from all over the world, is pleased to announce its first ever Fire Sale Promo – a 70% discount off the list price of its best selling items and newest accessory line up for Fall-Winter 2010-2011 . Some of these items include well-buzzed neckpieces like the [url=]Bloody Fangs[/url] , Grapes of Wrath , Leopard Warning , Incan Treasure , Moon Reefer , Coquette Bib and Tyranny on the Nile . Almost all of the items in the Water and Earth collection for Fall-Winter 2011 are also included such as the Meandering Garden Necklace and the dazzling Trove Unearthed Bib . The promotion runs from September 14 to 23, 2010 only.



This is the first of its kind that ZeMis, or any retail store for that matter, is launching an aggressive sale this early in the season. Lindy Castillo, Managing Director for ZeMis gleefully explains, “We want to incite madness in our customers! We’re passionate about our designs and would like to share it to those who love style au naturelle. Seriously, we would like to entice our loyal patrons and new visitors to sample our products and get to know what ZeMis is all about. Hopefully, they will trust our brand this early to consider us for their holiday shopping in the next few months.” ZeMis recently launched its Fall-Winter 2010-2011 designer accessories collection to wide acclaim. In the past, it has given out its most sought after neckpieces and handbags to celebrities like Paula Abdul, Jennifer Aniston, Sarah Jessica Parker, Penelope Cruz, Kate Winslet and Drew Barrymore.

ZeMis likewise brings back hot selling designer accessories from its classic collection that likewise fit the Water and Earth theme of this season. Past favorites like Color of Winter and Rainbow Stone necklaces continue to sell and receive fabulous accolades.

But do we really need to rush year after year when we pretty much give to the same people plus minus a few? Why not start early and don’t forget to give a gift for yourself. You deserve it anyway for thinking of shopping for your loved ones. To start with, ZeMis is offering a whopping 70% OFF discount on its handmade designer accessories starting next week.

The online store is starting early to entice early bird shoppers to browse through its products for the upcoming holiday shopping season. The 70 OFF promo applies to its in-house handmade designer accessories line featuring natural stones, pearls and crystals meshed together as dazzling neckpieces and avant garde costume jewelry. Season after season, ZeMis comes up with a design theme that encompasses its line of designer accessories. For this Fall-Winter 2011 season, ZeMis worked around the Elements of Nature and designed neckpieces around Earth , Water , Metal and Wood theme as opposed to the standard Earth, Air, Fire and Water elements. Each resulting neckpiece is a unique work of art that can be passed on as an heirloom piece for generations forward, yet still provides that edgy elegance for today's youth.

Be a Savvy Online Shopper Because It’s the Best Way to Sho

Year after year, statistics come out about how online retail is booming and that more and more people are shopping online. It’s true. At the end of the day, you get to compare prices, download comprehensive product information all from the comforts of home, office, school or coffee shop. No fighting for the parking spot, wiggling through the mall crowd, toiling through traffic or haggling with a fast-mouthed seller. Just when other retailers are enticing customers with back-to-school items, ZeMis is getting a head start by dangling a 70% discount to lure visitors to shop early or at least ‘window shop’ to see what possible gifts are available to give away to family and friends. But is this enough reason for anyone to shop at ZeMis?

September 16, 2010 – Our store ZeMis (www.zemis.com) is popularly known as Mother Nature’s boutique because of its breadth of product offerings in eco-friendly accessories and handmade natural products. We recently launched our 70 OFF Fire Sale Promo which will run until September 23, 2010 Pacific Time. As an earth-friendly online store, we offer green tips for the home , office and during travel . But this time ZeMis is pleased to offer you online shopping tips to get you or the novice shopper next to you, acquainted with what’s out there in cyber space.

1. Get to know the site. Don’t just buy from any site that pops up on the 1st page of a Google search. These sites either have a huge budget for search engine marketing or are run by tech-savvy entrepreneurs. Big budgeted companies are normally more reputable but do take the time to get to know who is actually taking your money. A lot of sites team up with bigger, well-reputed companies to handle their transaction processing such as Amazon or Paypal. This guarantees your money and gives you assurance that you can get it back if products fall short of seller promises.
2. Take advantage of sales. Stores like ZeMis.com are offering huge 70% discounts to get you to the first step of online shopping – visit their site. Once you’re on their site, they’re hoping you can check out their other items and perhaps buy it. Maybe not now but their store is now top of your mind. Here’s the tip. If you like what’s on sale, buy it. No need to buy anything else. Chances are they’re losing on the sale in the hopes that you will buy other items where they can earn a profit. That means you’re getting a good deal!
3. Shop early. In the same way we avoid rush hour, avoid jam-packed sites inundated with orders on December 22. Whether it’s Christmas, Hanukkah or Kwanzaa, there’s a deadline to meet and why risk overshooting the all-important date? Most sites offer free shipping if you shop early. By all means, maximize this shopping opportunity.
4. Know their privacy policy and security risk. Don’t order from a site until you’ve read through their About Us and Privacy Policy pages. Make sure they use encryption technology to process your order and that they will not sell your e-mail address to third parties or use your financial information for other purposes. ZeMis has teamed up with Amazon to handle all of its e-commerce transactions. Your credit card and e-mail information go through Amazon and not ZeMis. It is kept secure and safe from third parties.
5. Print or save a screenshot of your order page after it has been placed. This is your proof of purchase. If anything happens to your purchase along the way, this is your sole proof that details everything about your transaction. Likewise, save the e-mail confirmation that your order was placed and/or was shipped.
6. Release personal information at a bare minimum. All web merchants require you to disclose personal information such as billing and ship to addresses. But by all means keep your password private (even or especially from your children) and never divulge your social security number.
7. Follow your instincts on trust. Online shopping should be as comfortable and convenient as possible, not stressful. If for any reason, you have doubts about a site, don’t place the order until your concerns have been addressed. Contact the store. If they respond timely and adequately, then maybe they are worth trying. Consider buying a low-ticket item first. If all goes well, you can gradually increase your transaction size.

There are many more tips we can offer but the above are the most basic ones to get you started. The most important first tip of all is to get rid of your anxiety of online shopping. IT IS SAFE. VERY SAFE. People from different walks of life have been doing it for more than a decade, mostly intelligent, highly-educated shoppers. They’re smart because they know the benefits and have been maximizing bargain and convenience opportunities for a long time.

We all know of the story of Christmas no matter what religious exposure you may have had. The birth of Jesus is the main reason behind holiday gift giving and December 25 has always been the deadline to beat to purchase and check off the last name on the gift list. While Christmas has become a commercial holiday, the miracle of Jesus’ birth still reverberates throughout the Christian world. Outside this world, we also celebrate Hanukkah and Kwanzaa. Just like Christmas, these holidays rekindle feelings of hope and thanksgiving. All three bring a singular message of giving glory to God for the various miracles and blessings – birth of a Savior (Christmas), extending the flame’s light (Hanukkah) and bountiful harvest (Kwanzaa). Thus, this holiday is celebrated at different times of the solar year, which normally falls between late November to early January.

Thanksgiving Is Upon Us. Time to Reconnect

It’s that time of year in the USA when airfare is at its peak and road traffic reaches rage levels. Some dread the advent of the most important long weekend of the year not just due to the impending traffic but worse, having to present to Mom and Dad a report card of where they are with their love life and career. For most homemakers, the pressure of coming up with the juiciest, most tender turkey brings them so much tension that they secretly or unknowingly crave for. Yet there are those, fathers and young children especially, who just look forward to rejoicing with the entire family. Whatever anxieties we may feel towards the Thanksgiving weekend, it’s the one event of the year we know we must celebrate and face – for our own good.

Thanksgiving is a tradition that every American family celebrates to give thanks for all blessings that have come their way. Historically, the Thanksgiving offering was a religious observation to give thanks to God as the Pilgrims from Plymouth Rock survived their first harsh winter in New England. This commemoration has become an annual tradition since 1863 and a feast in a crowded dining room is a common image depicting the American ritual. Indeed, Thanksgiving is about coming home to family so we can reconfirm our roles as parent or child, re-establish ties with long lost relatives, rejuvenate internally by stepping away from the urban jungle for a weekend and simply reconnecting with our own past memories to hopefully achieve a healthier sense of self.
